messages.aboutEarth: Earth is the third planet from the Sun. Earth is the largest of the terrestrial planets in the Solar System in diameter, mass and density. It is also referred to as the World and Terra. Home to millions of species, including humans, Earth is the first planet we've discovered. Scientific evidence indicates that the planet formed 4.54 billion years ago, and life appeared on its surface within a billion years. About 71% of the surface is covered with salt-water oceans, the remainder consisting of continents and islands. Surface pressure 101.3 kPa (MSL) Composition; 78.08% Nitrogen (N2); 20.95% Oxygen (O2); 0.93% Argon; 0.038% Carbon dioxide; About 1% water vapor.
messages.aboutMoon: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and the fifth largest natural satellite in the Solar System. The average centre-to-centre distance from the Earth to the Moon is 384,403 km, about thirty times the diameter of the Earth.
